1.comment: Johnson's 13-of-22 for 106 yards, 1 touchdown (to Antonio Bryant) and a pick was better than anything Byron Leftwich could have hoped for. Johnson's horrid 4.8 YPA speaks for itself, but at least he could move around; he had 41 yards on 7 carries.    The Redskins may have won the game, but Campbell was not any better than Johnson. Campbell was just 12-of-22 for 170 yards, 2 touchdowns and 3 picks. He also had a fumble deep in his own territory at the beginning of the game to give the Buccaneers an easy opportunity to score. 2.comment: Johnson tossed 3 picks, but I was pretty impressed with him. He made some nice throws, moved the chains, ran well (5 carries, 40 yards) and even showed great leadership on the sidelines when the team was down. Unfortunately for Johnson (26-of-50, 240 yards, 2 TDs, 3 INTs), Tampa Bay was simply overmatched here. It should be noted how costly Johnson's 3 picks were. Two were thrown in the red zone. 4.comment: Johnson's decision-making. He compiled some junk yardage late, but at halftime was just 6-of-16 for 95 yards, a touchdown and 3 picks (1 on a Hail Mary). Expect Josh Freeman to be the starter once the Buccaneers come off their bye in Week 9.
